cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 40 mi (70 km) NE of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island and 110 mi (175 km) ENE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move slowly northwest today, turn north near the Florida east coast Wednesday, then accelerate north-northeast parallel to the Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coasts before moving into the North Atlantic toward Atlantic Canada.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or over the North Carolina coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge and hurricane watches/warnings currently extend from Deerfield Beach FL northward to South Santee River SC. No watches posted north of South Carolina.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm-surge warning Lantana FL to Savannah River GA; Hurricane warning Jupiter Inlet FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL; Tropical-storm warning North of Deerfield Beach FL to Altamaha Sound GA.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast, Georgia coast, South Carolina coast, and portions of North Carolina and the Mid-Atlantic offshore waters
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (forecast 2-4 inches for SE VA, less for central MD)
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤6%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; brief gusts 25–35 kt possible late Friday as the storm passes well offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in Chesapeake Bay; surge threat limited to open Atlantic beaches south of Maryland.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of moderate to heavy rain could bring 1–3 inches to the Baltimore area Friday, causing brief localized flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along nearby Atlantic beaches; possible maritime restrictions for vessels transiting the Chesapeake and coastal approaches.
